summary: This document consists of email correspondence regarding a real estate transaction involving a property at 338 Washington Rd, Bradford, NH. The emails discuss title searches, legal representation, and the need for an extension on the due diligence period. The correspondence highlights the importance of verifying wire instructions to prevent fraud.

persons.name: Steve Marshal
persons.context: Steve Marshal is attempting to purchase a house in Bradford and is seeking legal assistance for the title search and related legal questions.

persons.name: Ted
persons.context: Ted is mentioned as the contact person from Title who will be involved in the transaction.

persons.name: Jeff
persons.context: Jeff is suggested to be sent to Bradford to inquire about the property and review meeting minutes.

connections.description: Steve Marshal is seeking legal assistance from Ted regarding the title search for a property purchase.
Steve Marshal is directing Jeff to inquire about the property and assist with the transaction.

events.title: Effective Date of Purchase and Sale Agreement
events.description: The effective date of the Purchase and Sale Agreement is noted as November 19, although the seller did not sign until November 20.

events.title: Closing Date
events.description: The closing for the property purchase is set for December 13.

keyFacts: Steve Marshal is looking to purchase a property at 338 Washington Rd, Bradford, NH.
There is a need for an extension on the due diligence period for the title search.
The effective date of the Purchase and Sale Agreement is marked as November 19, 2019.
The closing date for the property is set for December 13, 2019.
The correspondence includes multiple warnings about verifying wire instructions to prevent fraud.
